dt: {bc}to guide by mechanical means (such as a rudder)
{bc}to direct the course (as of a ship or automobile)

pt: {sc}guide{/sc} {sc}lead{/sc} {sc}steer{/sc} {sc}pilot{/sc} {sc}engineer{/sc} mean to direct in a course or show the way to be followed. {sc}guide{/sc} implies intimate knowledge of the way and of all its difficulties and dangers.
{sc}lead{/sc} implies showing the way and often keeping those that follow under control and in order.
{sc}steer{/sc} implies an ability to keep to a course and stresses the capacity of maneuvering correctly.

pt.t: {it}steered{/it} the ship through a narrow channel

pt: {sc}pilot{/sc} suggests guidance over a dangerous or complicated course.
{sc}engineer{/sc} implies finding ways to avoid or overcome difficulties in achieving an end or carrying out a plan.

pt.t: {it}engineered{/it} his son's election to the governorship

et: Middle English {it}steren{/it}, from Old English {it}stīeran{/it}; akin to Old English {it}stēor-{/it} steering oar, Greek {it}stauros{/it} stake, cross, {it}stylos{/it} pillar, Sanskrit {it}sthavira, sthūra{/it} stout, thick
shortdef: to control the course of : direct; especially : to guide by mechanical means (such as a rudder)
to set and hold to (a course)
to direct the course (as of a ship or automobile)

dt: {bc}the column that encloses the connections to the steering gear of a vehicle (such as an automobile)

shortdef: the column that encloses the connections to the steering gear of a vehicle (such as an automobile)

dt: {bc}a committee that determines the order in which business will be taken up in a U.S. legislative body

shortdef: a managing or directing committee; specifically : a committee that determines the order in which business will be taken up in a U.S. legislative body

dt: {bc}a mechanism (such as a gear train) by which something is steered

shortdef: a mechanism (such as a gear train) by which something is steered

dt: {bc}a handwheel by means of which one steers

shortdef: a handwheel by means of which one steers

dt: {bc}a group of people who are in charge of managing or directing something

shortdef: a group of people who are in charge of managing or directing something

dt: {bc}an automotive steering system with engine power used to amplify the torque applied at the steering wheel by the driver

shortdef: an automotive steering system with engine power used to amplify the torque applied at the steering wheel by the driver

dt: {bc}a steering system in cars that uses power from the engine to make it easier to turn the steering wheel

shortdef: a steering system in cars that uses power from the engine to make it easier to turn the steering wheel
